General

Buttons

Accessibility Tips

  • A <button> doesn't need anything special to work. ARIA's role="button" is already assigned natively.
  • If you are using a link as a button, add the role="button" attribute.
  • Add class="visuallyhidden" with descriptive text to give more context to the button's purpose.
  • If your button is created entirely with an image/icon, you must include alt="" descriptions. If your button includes an image/icon that is decorative, you do not need an alt="" description.

WCAG 2.0 Guidelines

1.1.1 Non-text Content - All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose (some exceptions).

Note: If non-text content is pure decoration, is used only for visual formatting, or is not presented to users, then it does not need text alternatives. (Level A)
Read Moreabout the topic this article is pertaining to. Likethe topic this button follows. A11Yall the things.

modifier for centered buttons

Colors

Accessibility Tips

  • Avoid using color only to communicate information. In the case of links, use another identifier such as bold or underline to indicate a link verses using color alone.
  • Some users have difficulty reading text if there is too little contrast between foreground and background. To meet Level AA, text must have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 (or 3:1 for large text). In order to meet the guidelines at the stricter Level AAA, the contrast ratio must be at least 7:1 (or 4.5:1 for large text).

Accessibility Tools

Color Safe

Contrast Checker

Color Blindness Simulator

WCAG 2.0 Guidelines

1.4.1. Use of Color - Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element.

1.4.3 Contrast (Minimum) - The visual presentation of text and images of text has a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, except for some cases.

Link Focus

  • List of bullets
Focus Visible - Any keyboard operable user interface has a mode of operation where the keyboard focus indicator is visible.

Links

  • Add id selectors to titles and use aria-labelledby="" to link to the title text (example #1).
  • Add decriptive text with aria-label="" directly in the link (example #2).
  • Turn read more links into buttons, when you can.
Link Purpose - The purpose of each link can be determined from the link text alone or from the link text together with its programmatically determined link context, except where the purpose of the link would be ambiguous to users in general.

Example #1

Storms Hit East Coast

Torrential rain and gale force winds have struck the east coast, causing flooding in many coastal towns. Read More

Example #2

Black Bears Trapped in Cars?

Over the past three weeks there have been 15 reports or black bears getting themselves trapped in vehicles. There are several ways to prevent this from happening to you. Read More

Lists

This is a list component.

Info and Relationships - Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.

Example #2

Skip Links

  • List of bullets
Bypass Blocks - A mechanism is available to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on multiple Web pages.
